_header: Listen lordings and ye shall hear

BodAsh61.First Lines:
[L]ystyns lordynges & ȝe schall hereOff Ansystores
                    þat be fore vs wereBothe herdy & wyghtIn tyme of vter &
                    þendragon…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…There saulys went to heuen clereThere is Ioy eith outen
                    ende
BodAsh61.Editions:
Treichel,  A.,
                        ed.  
             “Sir Cleges, Ein mittelenglische Romanze.” 
             Englische Studien
         2 (1896): 345-89: 374-89.
McKnight,  George Harley. 
             Middle English Humorous Tales in Verse.
         Boston and London: Heath, 1913; repr. New York: Gordian, 1971: 38.
Laskaya,  Anna,  and  Eve Salisbury, eds.  
             The Middle English
                    Breton Lays.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 1995: 367-407.
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 180-5; 488-91; 608.

NLS19111.First Lines:
Will ye lystyn and ye schyll hereOf Eldyrs tþat before vs
                    were…
NLS19111.Last Lines:
…To Rech hys body wythThe Castell of Cardyffe he yaue hym
                    thoo…
NLS19111.Note: 44 stanzas plus 4 lines: 532 lines; ending imperfect.
